entry.title: Editor - document #65: Grid Certificate Profile - updates GFD.125-bis
entry.content:
• Assignee changed from Greg Newby to Jens Jensen

Authors/editors: there are a couple of public comments in the tracker. Please view and respond there or here as appropriate. If needed, you can make some updates to your final document. Once you are ready for the final review, please indicate so here (or via email).

The public comments:
http://redmine.ogf.org/projects/editor-pubcom/boards/8

-- Greg

• Status changed from AD review to public comment

Per AD recommendation, due to some extensive changes, we will seek a further 60-day public comment period for this document. Andre will enable, Greg will announce.

entry.title: Editor - document #65: Grid Certificate Profile - updates GFD.125-bis
entry.content: Update from the standards council telecon July 8 2014: This is being actively worked, heading towards completion soon. This will be #225, since it will obsolete (supersede) #125.

entry.title: Editor - document #65: Grid Certificate Profile - updates GFD.125-bis
entry.content: Update via email from Jens September 2: this is being addressed still, and progress is anticipated soon.

entry.title: Editor - document #65: Grid Certificate Profile - updates GFD.125-bis
entry.content: Would it be possible to get a PDF of the latest version of this uploaded to the CAOPS group's Redmine area https://redmine.ogf.org/dmsf_files/25 and/or to this page for better status tracking, please?

entry.title: Editor - document #65: Grid Certificate Profile - updates GFD.125-bis
entry.content:
• File igtf-certificate-profile-10.pdf added
  • Status changed from author action to initial review
  • Assignee changed from Jens Jensen to Greg Newby

This document - now to be published as GFD.225 - has been extensively revised, not just addressing the previous pub coms but also making it more consistent and a lot of minor mistakes and typos have been fixed.

It has been agreed that the document should be sent out for public comments again as it has changed significantly beyond addressing the previous comments - all editors now agree. Greg, please publish the attached version - igtf-certificate-profile-10.pdf - for another round.

entry.title: Editor - document #65: Grid Certificate Profile - updates GFD.125-bis
entry.content:
• Status changed from initial review to public comment

Document is ready for a second round of public comments. Greg, please announce.

entry.title: Editor - document #65: Grid Certificate Profile - updates GFD.125-bis
entry.content:
• Status changed from public comment to AD review
  • Assignee changed from Greg Newby to Jens Jensen

Dear Jens, all,

The second round of public comment did not yield anything significant (https://redmine.ogf.org/boards/14/topics/16). Shall we proceed with final standards council review? Thanks,
Greg

entry.title: Editor - document #65: Grid Certificate Profile - updates GFD.125-bis
entry.content: Note that we are waiting for AD input prior to moving forward with this document.

entry.title: Editor - document #65: Grid Certificate Profile - updates GFD.125-bis
entry.content: Status: Jens will give the (final) reading, looking for remaining fixes/updates. He will work to generate a final version for Standards Council final review.

entry.title: Editor - document #65: Grid Certificate Profile - updates GFD.125-bis
entry.content: Checking with Andre on status...

entry.title: Editor - document #65: Grid Certificate Profile - updates GFD.125-bis
entry.content: There is a final call for comments from the community (=IGTF/CAOPS-WG) with a deadline of Monday April 4th.

entry.title: Editor - document #65: Grid Certificate Profile - updates GFD.125-bis
entry.content: Per the standards council telecon on May 17, this document is still being discussed by the community.

entry.title: Editor - document #65: Grid Certificate Profile - updates GFD.125-bis
entry.content:
• Status changed from to be published to published

#225 is now online at https://www.ogf.org/ogf/doku.php/documents/documents , and will be announced on October 31. Thanks to the authors/editors for their efforts to get this document submitted, reviewed and published.
- Greg
